channel.title: BBC News - Middle East
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: The epic adventures of the Gilgamesh Dream tablet
item.description: How an ancient story of a superhuman king ended up in all sorts of unexpected places.

item.title: Eitan Biran: Italy cable car survivor to stay in Israel amid custody fight
item.description: Relatives are fighting over who should care for Eitan Biran, the sole survivor of a cable car crash.

item.title: The edible insects coming to a supermarket near you
item.description: A number of firms are now farming locusts and mealworms for human consumption.

item.title: Cavers descend into Yemen's 'Well of Hell' for first time
item.description: The 112m-deep pit has long been shunned by many local people, who believe it harbours genies.

item.title: My dad, held hostage in Iran
item.description: London-based baker Elika Ashoori is campaigning to bring her father home from jail in Iran.

item.title: Yemen war: Outcry over executions of nine men by Houthi rebels
item.description: The UN, EU, US and UK say their trial was not fair and was marred by torture allegations.

item.title: Israel recaptures final Palestinian escapees
item.description: The two were part of a six man group who tunnelled out of jail almost two weeks ago.

item.title: Hezbollah brings Iranian fuel into Lebanon to ease shortages
item.description: Lebanon's economic collapse has left the country dangerously short of fuel and electricity.

item.title: Three ex-US intelligence officers admit hacking for UAE
item.description: The three men allegedly helped a UAE-based firm break into computers and phones around the world.

item.title: Saudi Arabia camel carvings dated to prehistoric era
item.description: A new study suggests the sculptures in Saudi Arabia are far older than previously thought.

item.title: Iranian musician risks prison for new album
item.description: Mehdi Rajabian made an album in secret in his basement despite threats from Iranian authorities.

item.title: Nizar Banat: The death shaking the Palestinian leadership
item.description: The killing of Nizar Banat in Palestinian custody has fuelled rare protests calling for change.

item.title: Covid: What Israel tells us about the way out of the pandemic
item.description: Third jabs given as part of a booster programme are beginning to dampen the latest Covid surge.

item.title: Afghanistan: Qatar and Turkey become Taliban's lifeline to the outside world
item.description: Qatar and Turkey emerge as key channels between Afghanistan's new rulers and the outside world.

item.title: Gulf Sky: 'Our ship was hijacked and taken to Iran'
item.description: Former crew of the oil tanker Gulf Sky talk publically for the first time about the ship's disappearance.

item.title: How latte art led to a job from hell in Oman
item.description: A South African barista was offered a dream opportunity in Oman but unknowingly signed away his freedoms.

item.title: The murderous crime wave sweeping Israel's Arabs
item.description: Many killings often go unsolved, with blame being put on the police.

item.title: Tunisia crisis: Democrats, despots and the fight for power
item.description: Tunisia is in turmoil since the president suspended parliament and increased his own power.

item.title: The Taliban are back – will al-Qaeda follow?
item.description: Where is al-Qaeda 20 years after the 9/11 attacks - and could it re-emerge as a terror threat?

item.title: Lebanon: A country plunged into darkness
item.description: Lebanon’s ongoing crisis has plunged the country into darkness, with some experiencing power cuts for 20 hours a day.

item.title: Why Palestinians are protesting against their own government
item.description: Protests against the Palestinian Authority erupted after a popular activist died in custody.

item.title: Israeli conjoined twins see each other for first time after surgery
item.description: The Israeli twin girls were joined at the head but have been separated after a rare operation.

item.title: Iran prison abuse exposed by hackers' CCTV leak
item.description: Security footage released by hackers shows mistreatment inside Iran's notorious Evin prison.
